availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Franklin County Sct

I George W Goins a Justice of the peace for said County do Certify that on this day Genl Peter Dudley came personally before me in my Office and made oath that he would faithfully ^uphold to the best of his ability^ execute the provisions of th the act of the General assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky passed On the 23d day of May 1861. "A Senate Bill for the regulation of the Militia And to provide for the Arming of the State" Said Dudley being one of the Commissionsers appointed under, and to Carry out the objects of Said act --

Given under my hand this 25th day of May 1861.
Geo W. Gwin J. P. F. C

Samuel Gill this day appeared before the undersigned a Justice of the peace for Said County and took the oath mentioned in the within Certificate as administered to Genl Peter Dudly Witness my hand this 31st. day of May 1861
